alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:48PM CDT until June 16 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL PIKE...AUTAUGA...SOUTHWESTERN ELMORE...LOWNDES AND WESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 947 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Marbury to 6 miles northeast of Lowndesboro to near Kent, moving west at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. Wind gusts to 51 mph have been measured with this line of storms with reports of downed trees. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Montgomery, Prattville, Troy, Millbrook, Fort Deposit, Mosses, Hayneville, Deatsville, Autaugaville, White Hall, Gordonville, Billingsley, Lowndesboro, Booth, Vida Junction, Beechwood, Dublin, Autauga County Airport, Woodcrest and Maxwell Air Force Base. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
